mixed-citation.article-title: Taxonomic study of the genus Microplitis Förster, 1862 (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from Iran

tp:taxon-treatment.p: Fig. 7. Microplitis mandibularis Thomson, 1895 , ♀, TMUC-HBMMP0051. A . Habitus, dorsal view. B . Head, dorsal view. C . Mesosoma, dorsal view. D . Wings. E . Metasoma, dorsal view.

tp:treatment-sec.p: Body length 3.0– 3.5 mm ; antenna as long as body, F15 length 2.0 × its width ( Fig. 7A ); in dorsal view, head width less than 2.0 × its length ( Fig. 7B ); anteromesoscutum and mesoscutellar disc coriaceous ( Fig. 7C ); pterostigma length 2.5 × its width; vein R1 longer than pterostigma half; 1 st discal cell length 1.2–1.3 × its width; vein 1CUb 3.0 × as long as vein 1CUa ( Fig. 7D ); T1 length 2.5 × its maximum width, T1 rugulose and parallel-sided ( Fig. 7E ). Colour: body black; antenna and tegula reddish yellow; basal one third of pterostigma and legs yellow (except for black metacoxa).
Fars Province ( Samin et al. 2018 ), Alborz Province (present study).
